title: It's a Warm Spring... When Can I start Planting?

tasks.task: Determine the ideal time for planting spring mixes.
subtasks: Check soil temperature for germination.
Confirm air temperature to avoid winter kill.
Monitor long-term average and current soil temperatures.
Use a thermometer (even a food thermometer) to measure soil temperature.
Refer to Greencast for soil temperature projections (input zip code, check 5-10 year averages).
Check 10-day forecast for potential hard freezes.
Consider local conditions (soil biology, residue, moisture) when interpreting data.
Decide on planting depth based on anticipated emergence timing.
Plant seeds deeper (e.g., oats and peas) to protect from early freezes if soil is warm.
